Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
memorabilia \mem`o*ra*bil"i*a\, n. pl. [L., fr. memorabilis memorable. See {Memorable}.] 1. Things remarkable and worthy of remembrance or record; also, the record of them. [1913 Webster]
2. Mementos of past events; souvenirs. [PJC]
memorabilia n : a record of things worth remembering
